units.title: Embryoid body formation and neural induction
units.text: pluripotent stem cells (WTC, H9 and HES3 lines; the latter modified to report the expression of the retinal progenitor marker NKX2-1) were aggregated into embryoid bodies and cultured in minimal neural induction media (MNIM) to induce neuroectodermal fates (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Describes how to generate embryoid bodies and initiate neural fate.

units.title: Cell hashing and single-cell library preparation
units.text: each condition (Supplementary Fig. 1) were pooled and dissociated into single-cell suspensions, followed by cell hashing with barcoded antibodies and processing for single-cell transcriptome sequencing (3′ mRNA, 10x Genomics; Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Details the pooling, dissociation, hashing, and sequencing steps.

units.title: WNT pathway inhibition timing
units.text: Inhibition of the WNT pathway (XAV939) at early and intermediate time points (days 0–3, 10–13 and 14–17) led to
units.rationale: Specifies the timing of WNT inhibition as a procedural variable.

units.title: Retinoic acid concentration effects
units.text: a low concentration (c2–3) of RA promoted the emergence of retinal progenitors (SFRP2+) at lower RA concentrations and more ventralized and posterior fates (FOXA2+) at higher RA concentrations (Fig. 2d and Extended Data Fig. 3l,m).
units.rationale: Shows how RA dose influences lineage outcomes.

units.title: Short-pulse morphogen delivery
units.text: the delivery of sonic hedgehog (SHH), WNT, FGF8, retinoic acid (RA), BMP4 and BMP7 pathway modulators in short pulses over different time windows induces substantial changes in organoid composition.
units.rationale: Outlines a protocol for transient morphogen exposure.

units.title: Assessing heterogeneity with Shannon index
units.text: We measured the heterogeneity of each patterning condition at multiple time points, concentrations and combinations, and use the Shannon diversity index, where lower scores indicate lower cell-type diversity.
units.rationale: Provides a quantitative metric for evaluating patterning outcomes.

units.title: In situ HCR validation of lineage markers
units.text: In situ hybridization chain reaction (HCR) stainings confirmed the presence of more retinal progenitors (SFRP2+) at lower RA concentrations and more ventralized and posterior fates (FOXA2+) at higher RA concentrations (Fig. 2d and Extended Data Fig. 3l,m).
units.rationale: Describes a validation step using HCR staining.

units.title: Experimental workflow using multiplexed scRNA-seq
units.text: We established an experimental workflow to systematically test the remarkable effects, using cell hashing-based multiplexed scRNA-seq.

units.title: Applying morphogen concentration gradients
units.text: We apply concentration gradients in microfluidic chips or increasing static concentrations in multi-well plates and observe different patterning dynamics in each scenario.
units.rationale: Explains two methods for delivering morphogen gradients.

units.title: Quantifying cell-type composition via scRNA-seq
units.text: The single-cell transcriptomic readout allowed quantification of organoid cell-type composition for each morphogen treatment.
units.rationale: States how scRNA‑seq data are used to measure cell-type composition.
